name: YWPD-TC-319 - Verify that the user is able to create SWM Rule at Device Level and Rules -- @1.7

steps.name: Given The user successfully opened the yieldWerx web application and login
When Click on "SWM" in the left menu bar and click on SWM Rules
When Click on "New SWM Rule" button from SWM Rules window
When Create SWM Rules window will open and enter name as "4670-PrePostMerge-Missing-P" And description in "General" tab
When Click the "Input Data Selection" tab and Select level as "Device", Rules Validation as "Custom"
When Select the Source Facility as "WEB SMALL DATASET", Source Work Center as "WAFER SORT"
When Select the source device as "4670" and source probe as (1|M)
When Select Target Facility  as "WEB SMALL DATASET", Target Work Center  as "WAFER SORT
When Select Target Probe as (1|M) and Target Device as "4670"
When Click "Rule Definition" tab And Select rule Type from "BIN Rule" drop down
When Select one option from Die Exist in Wafers as "Die Exist in Both Source and Target Wafers"
When Select Source Wafer Bin as
When Select Target Wafer Bin as
When Select "Combine Bin" option from Combine Wafer Bin Details as "Custom BIN"
When Provide Hard Bin Number as "60", Soft Bin Number as "60"
When Select Bin Flag and other fields data
When Select Die Type as "Probe Die(s)"
When Select the one option from "Both"
When Enable "Copy bin number, probe site, reticle site and die type data as parameters?" checkbox if needed
When Click "Email Notification" tab
When Enter valid "Owner Name", "Owner Email Address" And Enter additional emails if needed
When Click the "Save" button
Then Verify that the rule will be saved and appear in the SWM Rules window

parameters.name: Die Exist in Wafers
parameters.value: Die Exist in Both Source and Target Wafers

fullName: SWM Rules: YWPD-TC-319 - Verify that the user is able to create SWM Rule at Device Level and Rules
